title: How to Breed Cows in Minecraft: Easily Explained!

steps.title: Gather wheat.
steps.content: Gather wheat. You grow wheat by planting grass seeds in tilled soil next to a water source. You can find grass seeds by breaking tall grass. Once wheat has been planted and matured, you can harvest it by breaking it. Alternatively, you can find wheat planted by villagers in villages . The time it takes wheat to grow and fully mature depends on the conditions it is grown. Wheat grows best in well-lit areas. Under ideal conditions, it takes wheat about 31 minutes to fully mature. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Locate 2 or more cows.
steps.content: Locate 2 or more cows. Cows spawn on grass blocks in well-lit areas. They spawn in herds of 2 or 3. Cows are pretty abundant in Minecraft. It shouldn't take long to find a couple. Once you find a couple of cows, you may want to build a fence around them to keep them from wandering off.

steps.title: Equip the wheat.
steps.content: Equip the wheat. To equip the wheat, open your inventory and drag the wheat into one of the hot bar spaces. Select the corresponding hot bar space at the bottom of the screen to hold the wheat. Cows will follow players holding wheat.

steps.title: Feed wheat to the cows.
steps.content: Feed wheat to the cows. Stand next to the cows and aim your reticle at them. Right-click or squeeze the left trigger button to feed wheat to the cows. Keep feeding them until you see hearts over their head. This indicates that the cows are in Love mode.

steps.title: Wait for the cows to breed.
steps.content: Wait for the cows to breed. Two cows near each other in Love mode will breed and immediately produce a calf.

steps.title: Wait for the calf to mature.
steps.content: Wait for the calf to mature. It takes calves about 30 minutes to fully mature into an adult cow. You can speed up this process by feeding the calf wheat. [2] X Research source
